Summary I am graduate of the University of Michigan. I hold Bachelor of Business Administration from Michigan's Ross School of Business and a Bachelor of Arts in Economics from Michigan's College of Literature Science and the Arts. I love Entrepreneurship and Innovation. I am entering my first year at Google as an Associate Product Marketing Manager.

Forever Go Blue! Experience Associate Product Marketing Manager: Google Partners Google September 2014  – Present (1 year) Mountain View, California Associate Product Marketing Manager Intern Google June 2013  –  August 2013  (3 months) Mountain View, California I worked on the go to market strategy on a yet to be announced Google product. This included drafting 50 in product emails while working with a legal team, an editing team and an engineering team to load into product. I interviewed and compiled customer stories for the new website while creating 10 uses cases for the site as well. Meanwhile, I helped devise a marketing strategy to cross promote the new product at launch. I also worked with the recruiting team to organize a mentor/intern field day. President MPowered Entrepreneurship June 2012  –  May 2013  (1 year) Ann Arbor, Michigan I served as the President of MPowered Entrepreneurship, an 100 person large organization dedicated to exposing students to entrepreneurship and supporting student entrepreneurs. I managed a $70,000 budget split between 13 projects. In my time as President, MPowered reached new heights by impacting over 6,000 students. (1 of 8 students at U of M, and 1 of 4 undergraduate students) We broke our previous world record for most student elevator pitches received in a student competition. Meanwhile, we set a new record for creating the largest student run Hackathon, MHacks, that 500 students from around the country attended. MPowered also organized a Startup Career Fair which connected 2000 students and 100 startups. Founding Chair University of Michigan Central Student Government Entrepreneurship Commission June 2012  –  May 2013  (1 year) Ann Arbor, Michigan I founded and chaired the first ever Entrepreneurship Commission through University of Michigan's Central Student Government. I recruited for the commission which was made up of the Presidents from the 15 entrepreneurship themed student organizations around campus. We supported each other's student organizations through funding and holding the first ever Month of Entrepreneurship at Michigan. Co-Founder Magnetic Hip Startup January 2012  –  September 2012  (9 months) Ann Arbor, Michigan I co-founded a magnetic hip startup with two other students at the University of Michigan. We were interested in alleviating pain caused by obstreperous in hips. We looked at implanting rare earth magnets in a compresable material that would be surgically implanted. I worked with laywers to go through the Provisional Patent process while researching the market size and opportunities. 1000 Pitches Director MPowered Entrepreneurship March 2011  –  March 2012  (1 year 1 month) Ann Arbor, MI I worked as the 1000 Pitches Director for MPowered Entrepreneurship at the University of Michigan. 1000 Pitches is the world's largest student-run elevator pitch competition. As the director, I fundraised $40,000 while managing a team of 30 members. I organized the logistics of the 8 week competition while overseeing the judging of the pitches. As director, 1000 Pitches broke the world record with 3,331 pitches. Experience Associate Product Manager - Google Fit Google August 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Mountain View, California I am the product manager for the Google Fit app. 
 
My recent responsibilities include: 
+ Leading the app through its initial launch, in the process defining our mission, strategy, minimum viable product and responding to internal feedback to get us to a launch-ready state.  
+ Leading prioritization efforts, establishing product vision and roadmaps and driving decision-making across leadership, engineering, design, marketing, PR, legal and release teams through multiple product iterations on our mobile/tablet Android applications, Android Wear application and web offering.  
+ Growing the app from initial launch to over 7 million users in 6 months. 
 
Latest official blog post for the app: http://officialandroid.blogspot.com/2015/05/google-fit-make-every-step-count.html Associate Product Manager - Google Flight Search Google September 2013  –  August 2014  (1 year) Zurich Product manager for the Google Flights frontend.  
 
My responsibilities included:  
+ Leading prioritization efforts, establishing product vision and roadmaps and drove decision-making across leadership, engineering, design, marketing, PR, legal and release teams through multiple product iterations on google.com/flights. 
 
Top launches include the following: 
+ Providing users with tips on how to change their flight to get a lower price and/or better experience 
+ Allowing users to save flights and share them with their travel partners 
+ Putting flight prices right into our date selector so users can be price-conscious from the start 
+ Working through technical constraints to develop a travel exploration feature where a user can get flight prices from their origin to top cities around the world 
+ Grouping flights results in commuter markets (e.g. LA -> NYC) for easier viewing, similar to transit schedules (also received patent for the UI) 
+ Launching the product in 20+ new languages and introducing currency selection for international users 
+ Evangelizing and representing the product both within the company as well as outside conferences and events such as being a keynote speaking at the Travel Executive Forum 
+ Revamping our PR and marketing efforts 
+ Actively recruiting for the Google, participating as a panelist at several external events and giving presentations at universities
